intro: Medicago angulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf medick, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial legume that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves with three oval or lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. Its seed pods are slender and contain several elliptical seeds. Medicago angulata is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some regions for forage or as a cover crop.
